job_purpose: Transforming people data into strategic insights that drive planning, workforce decision, and remuneration strategies at Perth Airport.
job_duties_and_responsibilities: Building dynamic reports and dashboards across performance, remuneration, talent, and workforce metrics.
Supporting major people cycles (rem reviews, succession planning) with accurate and timely data.
Using data modelling and visualisation tools like Power BI to inform workforce and business strategy.
Exploring AI and automation to improve reporting, efficiency, and access to insights.
Benchmarking against market trends and contributing to policy, reward, and organisational design.
Uplifting data literacy and empowering teams through self-service and education.
required_qualifications: A degree in HR, Business, Commerce, Data Analytics or related discipline.
Proven experience in people or workforce analytics with a solid understanding of HR systems and processes.
Advanced skills in data analysis and visualisation tools such as Excel and Power BI, with the ability to interpret trends and translate them into strategic insights.
Familiarity with remuneration benchmarking, workforce surveys, and supporting reward frameworks.
A proactive approach to exploring automation and AI tools to enhance reporting and decision-making.
Strong stakeholder engagement skills, with the ability to communicate complex data clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
A detail-oriented mindset with a commitment to data integrity, governance, and continuous improvement.
A collaborative and curious nature, always looking to learn and improve processes through innovation.
company_details: Perth Airport is Australia’s Western Hub connecting the people, businesses and communities of Western Australia with the rest of Australia and the world. Operating 24 hours a day, seven days a week throughout the year, Perth Airport plays a significant role in providing economic, social and cultural benefits to West Australians. Perth Airport is investing more than $5 billion in new infrastructure to support airline partners to grow, offering more services to new destinations and an improved customer experience.
